Notes.Text:
This update for strongswan fixes the following issues:

- CVE-2017-9022: Insufficient Input Validation in gmp Plugin leads to Denial of service (bsc#1039514)
- CVE-2017-9023: Incorrect x509 ASN.1 parser error handling could lead to Denial of service  (bsc#1039515)
- IKEv1 protocol is vulnerable to DoS amplification attack (bsc#985012)
Notes.Title: Details

Vulnerabilities.Description: The gmp plugin in strongSwan before 5.5.3 does not properly validate RSA public keys before calling mpz_powm_sec, which allows remote peers to cause a denial of service (floating point exception and process crash) via a crafted certificate.

Vulnerabilities.Description: The ASN.1 parser in strongSwan before 5.5.3 improperly handles CHOICE types when the x509 plugin is enabled, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (infinite loop) via a crafted certificate.
